unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – Leading telecom providers are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) networks across India, aiming to connect millions more homes to high-speed internet. Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, and BSNL are investing heavily in infrastructure upgrades, laying thousands of km of optical fiber cable.
normalised: Mumbai, october twenty six – Leading telecom providers are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) networks across India, aiming to connect millions more homes to high-speed internet. Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, and B S N L are investing heavily in infrastructure upgrades, laying thousands of kilometer of optical fiber cable.

unnormalised: This expansion is particularly focused on Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities, including Lucknow and Nagpur, where demand for reliable broadband connectivity is surging. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, a telecom analyst at the IIM Bangalore, notes that FTTH is crucial for supporting the growing digital economy.
normalised: This expansion is particularly focused on Tier-two and Tier-three cities, including Lucknow and Nagpur, where demand for reliable broadband connectivity is surging. Doctor Rajesh Kumar, a telecom analyst at the I I M Bangalore, notes that F T T H is crucial for supporting the growing digital economy.

unnormalised: Airtel recently announced plans to cover an additional 50,000 sq ft area in Chennai with FTTH by the end of the year. The expansion aims to cater to the increasing demand for online education, streaming services, and work-from-home arrangements.
normalised: Airtel recently announced plans to cover an additional fifty thousand square feet area in Chennai with F T T H by the end of the year. The expansion aims to cater to the increasing demand for online education, streaming services, and work-from-home arrangements.

unnormalised: BSNL is offering competitive FTTH plans, starting from Rs. 499, targeting budget-conscious consumers. These developments promise to bridge the digital divide and boost economic growth in the country.
normalised: B S N L is offering competitive F T T H plans, starting from rupee four hundred and ninety nine, targeting budget-conscious consumers. These developments promise to bridge the digital divide and boost economic growth in the country.
